page.title: 01SUMMARY AND STATISTICS.
page.content: Since 1921 the population of Southwold has been steadily going down:_ 1921 {3370 1931 {2753 1941 no census because of war, but population very low. 1951 {2473 1961 {2234 1971 {1998 1981 {1795 There are two main reasons for this decline:{a)}The population has very few young people, because of lack of job opportunities; most people are old and of course have no children because of this;when the old people die, the population goes down. {b)}Planning restrictions on building on the common mean few new houses; marshes and sea surround the town so there is no room for expansion.
